item.title: Why doesn't my ::pure command work (PI)
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Just like I thought, about 50 lines up is a condition

if (c.playerRights >= 3) {

That condition isn’t closed before your pure command.
Just move the pure command somewhere else…

item.title: Why doesn't my ::pure command work (PI)
item.dc:creator: @smkscape smkscape
item.description:
@smkscape wrote:

You can try:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure") && c.playerRights >= 0) { int i = 0; c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); }

Just edit it to whatever you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't my ::pure command work (PI)
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

James-RevolutionX:

I don’t think there is an error because 1. it would have showed up in compiler and 2.i’ve put it in a different position in a different commands.java.

It wouldn’t show an error, there’s no error in that code, its a masked error. Prevents your code from working right, but its valid code.

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't my ::pure command work (PI)
item.dc:creator: @Reamm28 Reamm28
item.description:
@Reamm28 wrote:

[quote=“James-RevolutionX, post:1, topic:351511”]When I change the player rights to 3 it works, but now that i’ve changed it to player rights 0 it doesn’t work, help? this is the code:

if(c.playerRights >= 0) {

		if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) {
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 0);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(0, 1);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 2);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 3);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 4);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(136594, 5);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 6);
                    } [/quote]

Lol! Why not delete the " if(c.playerRights >= 0) { " part?

item.title: Why doesn't my ::pure command work (PI)
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Maybe there’s a condition somewhere before the command?
Ex.

if(c.playerRights > 1) { //Stuff //Stuff //Stuff if(c.playerRights >= 0) { if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP(0, 1); c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP(136594, 5); c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 6); } } }
Have a look around

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't my ::pure command work (PI)
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

When I change the player rights to 3 it works, but now that i’ve changed it to player rights 0 it doesn’t work, help? this is the code:

if(c.playerRights >= 0) {

		if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) {
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 0);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(0, 1);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 2);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 3);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 4);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(136594, 5);
                                            c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 6);
                    }
